intro: Canthium pseudorandii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit capsules. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has alternate, simple leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. The species is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for certain insects and animals.
